      • addNewDigestList

        public static void addNewDigestList(Map<String,List<String>> newMap,
                                    String term,
                                    String digest)
        start a new digest list for term using map from column -> termLength
        Parameters:
        newMap - string -> digest-list map
        term - term to be indexed
        digest - digest of postings for term

      • generateMaps

        public void generateMaps(List<MultiKeyIndex.Record> recordTable,
                         int[] columns)
        Generate in-memory term dictionary
        Parameters:
        recordTable - list of record instances
        columns - which columns of records to use as keys.

      • writePostings

        public Map<String,MultiKeyIndex.Extent> writePostings(String workingdir,
                                                      String indexname)
                                               throws IOException
        Write postings to posting pool file while filling digest -> posting extent map that is returned at end of processing.
        Parameters:
        workingdir - working directory
        Returns:
        map of string -> start, offset pairs (extents)
        Throws:
        IOException

      • writePartitions

        public void writePartitions(String workingDir,
                            String indexname,
                            Map<String,MultiKeyIndex.Extent> digestExtentMap)
                     throws FileNotFoundException,
                            IOException
        Using column length term digest map and digest extent Map, create partitions consisting of two files: a dictionary containing term, num-of-postings, and pointer to extent list and extext list pool containing offset length pairs, one for each posting.
        Parameters:
        workingDir - working directory
        indexname - name of index
        digestExtentMap - map of digest -> start length pairs (extents)
        Throws:
        IOException
        FileNotFoundException
